name: Matrix Square Up,  B!
description: Welcome. Welcome all to my very second Kata. As you know, the first one was a huge success. This time, however, things are going to be a little bit different. Is it going to be as cool as the last one? Let's find out! Tell your friends! ï˜‹ Given an integer b greater than 0, create and return a b X b matrix with the following pattern: [x,1] matrixSquareUp(2) => [2,1] [x,x,1] [x,2,1] matrixSquareUp(3) => [3,2,1] [x,x,x,1] [x,x,2,1] [x,3,2,1] matrixSquareUp(4) => [4,3,2,1] Those are lowercase 'x'. 50 > b > 0 ~~~if:fortran *NOTE: Due to the nature of Fortran (multidimensional) arrays and character strings, the strings inside your matrix are allowed to contain trailing whitespace - the strings will be compared using ordinary string comparison (*`==` *operator which appends trailing whitespace to the shorter string before comparing the two).* ~~~ # Check out my other kata!
